title: bitnote
author: bitnote
content: I was searching for indian nfts and found this platform https://www.bollycoin.com/ which is an bollywood nft's marketplace.what do you think about designing and selling indian nfts like this? is nfts profitable in india?

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Never heard about this coin and won't recommend anyone to buy it. If you want to buy NFT then OpenSea is the best marketplace. All major and upcoming NFT's get listed on that platform. I did check thier domain details and found it to be registered from 2018 till 2024. Still, it is not that easy to trust any platform on the internet

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: I would never recommend anyone to buy NFTs like this.Let it be about big celebs or bollywood artists, it does not make any difference. NFTs have been the buzz and have gone down the drain to make way for the next buzzword. Buy them at your own risk, I personally would not.Sadly the OP of this thread has been away for some time. Hope they join us back soon.

comments.author: kentrolla
comments.body: IMO NFTs are worthless and there was a time people used to buy it like sheep due to endorsement by some celebrities and now we have seen celebrities like Cristina Ronaldo, Logan Paul getting sued and moreover I have never heard of this project and as far as Indian market is concerned or let any South Asian market for that reason NFT is useless and people don't want to invest into digital art. Better to stay away from NFT projects itself be it any NFT projects.

comments.author: Ravichnadra
comments.body: Hello there,New year to all Yes, Bolly Coin is a Bollywood marketplace. more than 12 million Bollycoins are available for purchase, with one Bollycoin costing $0.1 (Rs 7.49).
